context_meta.title: Can’t get enough of ‘Doom’? A.I. can generate an infinite number of new levels
context_meta.summary: Researchers from Italy have developed an artificial neural network that’s capable of generating a theoretically infinite number of new levels of the classic 1993 first-person-shooter 'Doom'.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Headset maker's stock up 700% on 'Fortnite' mania
context_meta.summary: The "Fortnite" and "PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds" games are all the rage, giving a monstrous boost to a company that makes gaming accessories. Turtle Beach, which sells headphones specifically designed for gamers under the Stealth, Elite Pro and Recon brands, said last week that quarterly sales surged 185%. Turtle Beach also raised its revenue and profit outlook for the year. Shares of Turtle Beach (HEAR), which trades under the cutesy ticker symbol of HEAR, have more than doubled in the past five days and are now up a whopping 766% this year. They were down about 2% Monday though after last week's impressive run. "Fortnite" and "PlayerUnknowns's Battlegrounds" are so-called battle royale games,

context_meta.title: 2,800 NES customers affected by power outage around Centennial Park
context_meta.summary: NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) - Approximately 2,800 NES customers are without power right now around Centennial Park in west Nashville. NES says crews have responded to the scene and are working to restore power. It's not clear what is causing the power outage. Stay with News4 for updates on this developing story.

context_meta.title: Possible Legendary Bullpup Burst Fire Assault Rifle Leaked In 'Fortnite: Battle Royale'
context_meta.summary: Fortnite continues to add and subtract weapons from the game, and this time, some coveted new guns are probably being added, according to a recent leak. The info comes from Fortnite Tracker, which pulls data files from the game and turns them into potential leaks to share. This time, they’ve discovered a new pair of assault rifles, the “Bullpup Burst,” which would fill out the family tree of the existing grey, green and blue burst fire assault rifles.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: The Companies Making The Most From Video Games [Infographic]
context_meta.summary: Tencent is the public company with the highest video game revenue according to research conducted by market intelligence firm Newzoo. Excluding hardware, the Chinese giant raked in just over $18 billion from its gaming business in 2017, far ahead of second-placed Sony ($10.5 billion) and third-placed Apple ($8.0 billion). Tencent has been ramping up its investment in gaming companies in recent years and notable examples include stakes in Riot Games (2011), Epic Games (2012), CK Games (2015) and Robot Entertainment (2015). Tencent took a major step in boosting its gaming revenue even further when it unveiled WeGame in April 2017, its own flagship gaming portal which hosts games and content as

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Almost Four Years Later, 'Destiny 2' Has Quietly Revealed The Identity Of The Exo Stranger
context_meta.summary: Destiny fans were not amused when during an interview with D2 game director Luke Smith, he spoke candidly about a few story topics. One, he admitted that the writers didn't really have any real idea what “The Darkness” was when the game launched, and the term has been written out of the game since. Secondly, he said that the most mysterious character of the vanilla game, the Exo Stranger, had her arc wrapped up “effectively” and would be gone forever. “We have a bunch of characters who are interesting, but the Exo Stranger is one that always makes me chuckle a little bit,” Luke Smith. “Because I feel that's one character where we actually wrapped up the arc. context_meta.title: 'Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon' Goes All 8-Bit And Is Released At The End Of May
context_meta.summary: One of the stretch goals for the original Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night was an 8-bit game and it seems that Curse of the Moon intends to fulfill that requirement once it is released at the end of May. If you are a fan of the 8-bit era of Castlevania games, then Curse of the Moon looks exactly like the kind of game you might enjoy. With four playable characters, that of Miriam, Zangetsu, Alfred, and Gebel, it seems that the gameplay will be nicely varied as a result (shown below). If you remember, I actually interviewed Koji Igarashi back in March, where he talked about his work on Bloodstained as well as his love for the classic isekai mecha anime Aura Battler Dunbine. context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: After books and vinyl, board games make a comeback
context_meta.summary: Forget Candy Crush, Fifa and Call of Duty – millennials are putting down their Xbox controllers and smartphones and picking up their dice as they embrace games their parents and grandparents used to love. More and more people are exchanging marathon gaming sessions alone in a darkened room for the social fun of board games. With bars and cafes such as Thirsty Meeples in Oxford, and Draughts in London having a library of more than 800 games catering for the “cocktails and Cluedo” set, board games – as with colouring books – are no longer just Christmas presents for children. Early next month tens of thousands of enthusiasts will descend on Birmingham NEC for the UK Games Expo, the third-largest hobby and games convention in the world.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: 8 tips for mastering 'Fortnite,' the biggest game in the world
context_meta.summary: "Fortnite" controls can feel cumbersome and overwhelming at first — because they're totally cumbersome and overwhelming. This is especially true for the building aspect of the game, which demands that players switch between buildable objects rapidly while under fire. If you're playing on PlayStation 4 or Xbox One, switching between materials is handled by the shoulder buttons. It's difficult and slow, but there's a brilliant way to fix that problem: Switch the default controller settings to "Builder Pro." In this setting, each material is mapped to one of the shoulder or trigger buttons. It's a little tricky at first, but — despite the "pro" name — is actually far easier to use for building.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: 'Dota 2' world championship starts crowdfunding drive
context_meta.summary: The August 2018 edition of "Dota 2" world championship The International has raised over $7m USD in three days. Since The International started crowdfunding its prize pool, each subsequent edition has exceeded the total raised by its predecessors.

context_meta.title: Battle Royale bonus round: 'Avengers' in 'Fortnite,' 'PUBG' names map, 'Dota 2' mode
context_meta.summary: "Avengers: Infinity War" villain Thanos enters "Fortnite" as a playable character, "PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds" welcomes Sanhok, and enormous tournament eSport "Dota 2" announces an Underhollow mode in the week ending May 11, 2018. If the initial imagery for Season 4 of "Fortnite: Battle Royale" made obvious reference to superhero couture, we now know why that was. Not only did update v4.0 arrive shortly after "Avengers: Infinity War" started rolling up box office records, but developer Epic Games had an official "Fortnite x Avengers" crossover waiting in the wings.

context_meta.title: Konami Reports Most Profitable Year Yet at Over $2 Billion, Mum on 'Metal Gear Survive'
context_meta.summary: Even factoring in operating costs of Konami Holdings Corporation, the company made a profit of ¥45,181 million yen ($413 million USD), an increase of 24.3% from the previous year. Konami also put an increased focus this past year on markets other than consumer, console game titles. “In the game industry, efforts are accelerating to offer new experiences through game content in various ways, including eSports, which are regarded as a form of sports competition and are attracting more and more attention,” states Konami's financial report. context_meta.summary: The next set of premium Season 4 skins just hit the market in Fortnite: Battle Royale. We may have taken a bit of a detour with club kids Nitelite and Liteshow, but now we're squarely back inside of Season 4's superhero narrative with these Chromium and Diecast skins -- the female and male versions of a similar looking metal-clad warrior. They're both matched to the excellent Persuader Pickaxe, which is basically four missiles on a stick. These characters leaked before, but now we have a better idea of just how they fit into things.
